children.subject: Given your situation and the draft course schedule for next semester, I would recommend CS188 or CS194-26. The workload for CS194-26 might be heavy.

history.content: <md>Your best bet is probably 188 if you want to not stress too much. The content is pretty interesting, and the workload is pretty low compared to other upperdivs. The other ML courses 189/280/288/285 are probably much more time consuming that you would want to take. 194-26 could be an option, but it is a very classical take on computer vision and the workload is non-trivial. If you really want NLP, you can try Info 159 if you can get in, but it isn't an EECS course. If there are any other cool ML based topics course that come out on the draft schedule, you can look into them, however, the workload might very wildly as these courses are usually less mature and sometimes the workload can fluctuate throughout the semester. </md>

children.subject: EECS 126 if you haven't. It's such a wonderful class with a tons of extremely important knowledge across multiple aspects!

history.content: Hi everyone, I'm having a great time with CS 182 this spring and will graduate next fall. I need one more EECS course to graduate and would like to take another course in machine learning or something related such as computer vision, artificial intelligence or natural-language processing. I've also already taken data 100 and EE 127. Given it's my last semester I also don't want something that will take too much of my time. What courses would be good choices?
history.subject: ML-related courses to take after Intro to Neural networks
